p: Fifty grams of naturally dried aerial parts were sampled for analysis. Woody parts of plants were separated and then remainder parts hydro-distilled for 3.5 h by a Clevenger-type apparatus (Weisany et al., 2016a, b). The obtained EO was dehydrated using anhydrous sodium sulfate and stored in sealed vials at 4Â°C, until further analyses. To measure main constituents of EO, all treatments belonged to a given repetition were chosen in second harvest (Weisany et al., 2015).
